properties.areaDesc: Cleveland; Arkansas; Jefferson; Saline; Lonoke; Lincoln; Prairie; Grant; Pulaski
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 12:33AM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
At 1232 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near South Bend to near Estes to 6 miles south
of Redfield to 6 miles southeast of Sheridan. Movement was east at 30
mph.

Winds in excess of 40 mph will be possible with these storms.

Locations impacted include...
Little Rock...                    North Little Rock...
Pine Bluff...                     Sherwood...
Jacksonville...                   Stuttgart...
Sheridan...                       Lonoke...
Hazen...                          De Valls Bluff...
White Hall...                     England...
Carlisle...                       Wrightsville...
Redfield...                       Altheimer...
Humphrey...                       Fredonia...
Humnoke...                        Keo...
properties.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR NORTHEASTERN CLEVELAND... SOUTHEASTERN PRAIRIE...LONOKE...NORTHEASTERN GRANT...JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN SALINE...NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHEASTERN PULASKI AND NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS COUNTIES UNTIL 115 AM CST
